headline.main: Cassel Will Start at Quarterback When Vikings Face the Steelers in London

headline.main: First-Round Picks Pay Off in Jets’ Pass Rush

headline.main: Giants’ Snee and Baas Out Against Chiefs

docs.snippet: FIFA has ordered Ukraine to play its next World Cup qualifier in an empty stadium after its fans shouted racist abuse during the team’s match against San Marino....
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA has ordered Ukraine to play its next World Cup qualifier in an empty stadium after its fans shouted racist abuse during the team’s match against San Marino.
docs.abstract: FIFA fines Ukraine $50,000 and orders team to play its next World Cup qualifier in an empty stadium after fans shouted racist abuse during team's 9-0 win against San Marino; other soccer news noted.

headline.main: Ukraine Is Penalized for Fans’ Racist Abuse
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Is Penalized for Fans’ Racist Abuse

docs.lead_paragraph: A top University of Texas booster who arranged a telephone conversation with Alabama Coach Nick Saban’s agent said the talk lasted 45 minutes
docs.abstract: Top University of Texas booster Tom Hicks, who arranged a telephone conversation with Alabama Coach Nick Saban’s agent, says the talk lasted 45 minutes and that the agent was asked whether Saban would be interested in coaching the Longhorns.

headline.main: Texas Booster Discusses Call About Saban

docs.snippet: A plan to distribute the money has not been decided, and the settlement leaves the N.C.A.A. as the lone defendant in the lawsuit filed more than four years ago....
docs.lead_paragraph: A plan to distribute the money has not been decided, and the settlement leaves the N.C.A.A. as the lone defendant in the lawsuit filed more than four years ago.
docs.abstract: EA Sports and Collegiate Licensing Company are set to pay $40 million to settle their roles in a high-profile lawsuit seeking compensation for college athletes; plan leaves NCAA as lone defendant in lawsuit filed more than four years ago by former UCLA basketball player Ed O'Bannon.

headline.main: E.A. Sports and Collegiate Licensing to Pay $40 Million to Compensate Athletes

docs.snippet: NBC Sports Group has gone big with covering Premier League soccer games as part of a three-year deal. The viewership numbers have shown that the formula for full-blown coverage has been working....
docs.lead_paragraph: NBC Sports Group has gone big with covering Premier League soccer games as part of a three-year deal. The viewership numbers have shown that the formula for full-blown coverage has been working.
docs.abstract: NBC Sports Group has gone big with its coverage of England's Premier League soccer as part of three-year deal, and viewership numbers are proving that the formula for full-blown coverage is working.

headline.main: Premier League Coverage Pays Off for NBC
headline.print_headline: Network Captures Flavor Of the Premier League
